intro: Echinocereus glycimorphus, commonly known as the honeycomb cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, solitary cactus that typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters. The plant features a ribbed stem with prominent, tuberculate areoles that bear clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it produces fleshy, red to purple fruits that are edible. This cactus is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
